intro: Tilmia, commonly known as the "garden bell," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Campanulaceae. These plants are native to various regions in Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and they are often found in meadows and woodland edges. Tilmia species typically feature showy, bell-shaped flowers that can range in color from white to purple, depending on the species. The plants are herbaceous, with upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
